text: Hi All, quick question, is there a way to update the AMP version of a blog page in HubSpot? Thanks in advance :slightly_smiling_face:
Not much control except the AMP options in the content settings
last time I checked which was a little while ago

thanks for your response <@UDARG2NKZ>, i have opened the same question as well here, <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/Blog-Website-Page-Publishing/How-to-update-the-AMP-version-of-a-blog-post-in-HubSpot/m-p/252014/highlight/false#M2203>. Not quite sure why didn't the updates we did for the blog post didn't reflect on its AMP version.
ah sorry I thought you were talking about the design
do you have a link to the blog in question?
ah no, sorry for the confusion, here is the link <https://www.tribegroup.co/blog/ahead-of-the-wave-how-bacardi-created-their-mojito-moment?hs_amp=true>
at first glance it's looking the same, is there a paragraph you can point out that's different?
oh actually the last line
hmm yea very odd
we have updated a URL in the content from http to https. The changes reflects in the blog post but not in its AMP version. Please see highlighted element in the attached screenshot
do you thinks it is a bug or something from HubSpots end?
yea i'm stumped
I'd guess it would have to do with cache but breaking the cache isn't updating it
HS support should be able to look into it further
Cached amp content
Not a HubSpot issue
I believe there is a method to flush it.
<https://developers.google.com/amp/cache/update-cache>
Quick Google search. Maybe in there
Google have re-index and re-crawled the blog page and its AMP version last Feb 8, 2019, 11:54:55 AM and the changes was applied before that but still the same.
Hmm
I know that amp content is not necessarily stored on Google servers.
but should it be expected that once the blog post content was updated it will update its AMP version the same time, right? Or does it works differently?
Wish I was more help.
I still feel it is an amp issue and not a HubSpot issue.

its okay <@UD53A9UUR>, I appreciate your help and <@UDARG2NKZ> as well.. Thanks guys! I'll look further in this issue, thou I've been looking for a way to fix this last week, was hoping that Google re-index might help :white_frowning_face:.

hii everyone,
If we use any external js from file manager in our custom module of template. and anyone purchase that template, then how we transfer these external files from our file manager. If there is any option please let me know.
